intro: Siphocampylus pennellii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant has compound leaves with serrated margins and produces small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Siphocampylus pennellii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for xeriscaping.
